briefdescription.para: constructs a standalone syclFlow from the default queue

detaileddescription.para: A standalone syclFlow does not go through any taskflow and can be run by the caller thread using explicit offload methods (e.g., tf::syclFlow::offload).

briefdescription.para: constructs a standalone syclFlow from the given queue

detaileddescription.para: A standalone syclFlow does not go through any taskflow and can be run by the caller thread using explicit offload methods (e.g., tf::syclFlow::offload).

briefdescription.para: destroys the syclFlow
queries the emptiness of the graph
queries the number of tasks
dumps the syclFlow graph into a DOT format through an output stream
clear the associated graph

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_invocable_r_v< void, F, sycl::handler &>, void > *

briefdescription.para: creates a task that launches the given command group function object

detaileddescription.para:
F
type of command group function object
func
function object that is constructible from std::function<void(sycl::handler&)>
Creates a task that is associated from the given command group. In SYCL, each command group function object is given a unique command group handler object to perform all the necessary work required to correctly process data on a device using a kernel.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_invocable_r_v< void, F, sycl::handler &>, void > *

briefdescription.para: updates the task to the given command group function object

detaileddescription.para: Similar to tf::syclFlow::on but operates on an existing task.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< std::is_invocable_r_v< sycl::event, F, sycl::queue &, std::vector< sycl::event >>, void > *
std::enable_if_t< std::is_invocable_r_v< sycl::event, F, sycl::queue &, std::vector< sycl::event >>, void > *

briefdescription.para: creates a memcpy task that copies untyped data in bytes

detaileddescription.para:
tgt
pointer to the target memory block
src
pointer to the source memory block
bytes
bytes to copy
a tf::syclTask handle A memcpy task transfers bytes of data from a source locationA src to a target location tgt. Both src and tgt may be either host or USM pointers.

briefdescription.para: creates a memset task that fills untyped data with a byte value

detaileddescription.para:
ptr
pointer to the destination device memory area
value
value to set for each byte of specified memory
bytes
number of bytes to set
a tf::syclTask handle Fills bytes of memory beginning at address ptr with value. ptr must be a USM allocation. value is interpreted as an unsigned char.

briefdescription.para: creates a fill task that fills typed data with the given value

detaileddescription.para:
T
trivially copyable value type
ptr
pointer to the memory to fill
pattern
pattern value to fill into the memory
count
number of items to fill the value
Creates a task that fills the specified memory with the specified value.

briefdescription.para: creates a copy task that copies typed data from a source to a target memory block

detaileddescription.para:
T
trivially copyable value type
target
pointer to the memory to fill
source
pointer to the pattern value to fill into the memory
count
number of items to fill the value
Creates a task that copies count items of type T from a source memory location to a target memory location.

briefdescription.para: creates a kernel task

detaileddescription.para:
ArgsT
arguments types
args
arguments to forward to the parallel_for methods defined in the handler object
Creates a kernel task from a parallel_for method through the handler object associated with a command group.

briefdescription.para: invokes a SYCL kernel function using only one thread

detaileddescription.para:
F
kernel function type
func
kernel function
Creates a task that launches the given function object using only one kernel thread.

briefdescription.para: applies a callable to each dereferenced element of the data array

detaileddescription.para:
I
iterator type
C
callable type
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
callable
a callable object to apply to the dereferenced iterator
a tf::syclTask handle This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop on a GPU:

memberdef.argsstring: (I first, I last, I step, C &&callable)
memberdef.name: for_each_index

briefdescription.para: applies a callable to each index in the range with the step size

detaileddescription.para:
I
index type
C
callable type
first
beginning index
last
last index
step
step size
callable
the callable to apply to each element in the data array
a tf::syclTask handle This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop on a GPU:

memberdef.argsstring: (I first, I last, C &&callable, S... srcs)
memberdef.name: transform

briefdescription.para: applies a callable to a source range and stores the result in a target range

detaileddescription.para:
I
iterator type
C
callable type
S
source types
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
callable
the callable to apply to each element in the range
srcs
iterators to the source ranges
a tf::syclTask handle This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop on a SYCL device:

briefdescription.para: performs parallel reduction over a range of items

detaileddescription.para:
I
input iterator type
T
value type
C
callable type
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
result
pointer to the result with an initialized value
op
binary reduction operator
a tf::syclTask handle This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop on a SYCL device:

briefdescription.para: similar to tf::syclFlow::reduce but does not assume any initial value to reduce

detaileddescription.para: This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop on a SYCL device:

briefdescription.para: offloads the syclFlow onto a GPU and repeatedly runs it until the predicate becomes true

detaileddescription.para:
P
predicate type (a binary callable)
predicate
a binary predicate (returns true for stop)
Repetitively executes the present syclFlow through the given queue object until the predicate returns true.
By default, if users do not offload the syclFlow, the executor will offload it once.

briefdescription.para: offloads the syclFlow and executes it by the given times
offloads the syclFlow and executes it once

memberdef.argsstring: (syclTask task, void *tgt, const void *src, size_t bytes)
